name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Watertown-Thousand Islands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night here last month. We opted for the Romance Package because it sounded lovely and the website implied that breakfast would be via room service. We arrived to discover that this "Garden Inn" is located between a busy interstate and a huge, mostly untenanted strip mall, next to a Holiday Inn of similar size. Granted you could walk a quarter mile to Starbucks or Ruby Tuesday's, but there was NO shopping available that didn't require driving. Thinking we'd have more quiet, we asked that our room be away from the highway.
reviews.title: Not a Garden by any stretch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was normal. The people were friendly. We entered our room to find a nice-enough looking king bed with a jacuzzi in a raised "marble" surround. I would NOT have described the room as a suite as the website did. There was a single room, with a king bed, a desk and a chair. There was a small counter with a small fridge, microwave & coffee maker. In every other hotel I've stayed, a suite included a separate sitting area, with at least a couch. Most have had separate TV's etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Room

reviews.text: The Romance Package, which we thought would include flowers, a bottle of sparkling cider and breakfast in bed (this is what we've received at other chain hotels) consisted of a bottle of sparkling cider in an ice bucket and two glasses. Adding the package added more than $25 to our bill. Hardly worth it.
reviews.title: Awesome stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was advertised as "Evolution Adjustable", supposedly meaning that we could each adjust our side's softness. Either the bed didn't work or we are too insensitive, but we could feel no real difference no matter where we set the dials on each side. Linens were scatchy, as though not laundered enough to get the newness out of them. I found this very uncomfortable, especially with the pillows.
reviews.title: best in watertown

reviews.text: Even thought we were on the strip mall side of the hotel, we were not saved from traffic noise. Apparently the mall is used as a thoroughfare by the locals and this included people with no mufflers and folks who believe the music in their cars needs to be heard by everyone within a 2 mile radius. We were woken several times during the night by this kind of noise. We later realized that there was two pizza joints in the strip mall, and a Buffalo Wild Wings on the other side of the Holiday Inn. We suspect these establishments might have drawn the rowdier motorists. My main point here is that we could HEAR all this through the windows. I shudder to think what the guests on the side of the highway have to listen to, especially since there are ramps with steep grades beside the hotel. Imagine the sound the 18-wheelers must make climbing or slowing down on those?
reviews.title: Beautiful property but...

reviews.text: rooms were very up to date and clean heat on room was very hard to control a bit warm exercise room a bit small but overall very nice hotel
reviews.title: very clean

reviews.text: We did a weekend shopping trip on Family Day Weekend (Feb 18-20, 2012) in Ontario and this new (less than a year old) hotel is ideally situated just East (left) of I-81 on Arsenal Street (exit 45).
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great food, Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The All American Grille is not fancy but there food is standard restaurant fare, hot and well cooked. The flatbread pizzas are amazing, seafood pasta dishes quite nice and the house wines -- at $5 a glass -- are a great deal. Similar meals at local chain restaurants would have run us $20 to $30 more for poorer quality, more sodium and more fat!
reviews.title: Great facility, poor service

reviews.text: Rooms are very clean, comfortable with 36 inch Phillips Flat screens, along with nice Neutrogena products in the bathroom and adjustable firmness beds to boot. They also have an excellent little gym for a hotel of this size -- two treadmills, two elipticals, on seated stationary bike, free weight dumbells with adjustable bench -- complete with two areas for stretching/core work.
reviews.title: Great for Families

reviews.text: Syracuse is just an hour away (Carousel Center) to the South and a mall in Clay, NY is less than an hour a way. Waterloo oulets are about 95 mins away.
reviews.title: free breakfast trumps the competition

reviews.text: SUPER hotel, very nice, new and spotless. Great Breakfast too! Stayed on our way to upstate NY, Amy and Meagan went WAY above the call of duty to help us confirm reservations at another hilton property. It is so nice to stay at a hotel where the staff sincerely wants to help us travelers! Thank you Amy and Meagan, you both did a fantastic job for us.
reviews.title: Great property, Great Staff

reviews.text: Kutos to the kitchen staff, they do a super job....
reviews.title: New and comfortable hotel!

reviews.text: I spent last weekend with my daughter and her husband for the weekend at this hotel. Super friendly staff, and the room was great! The queen size beds were so comfortable and the room and bathroom were impeccable. Loved our short stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!
Good accomidations on short notice
reviews.text: This hotel was a great stop for me! It was very clean and comfortable. The staff were really nice and the breakfast was good. I will definitely stay here the next time I'm in the area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed due to blizzard on highway. was given a discounted rate for a decent room.nothing special but what you woukd expect with good service from staff.
reviews.title: The beds are horrible!

reviews.text: Overall a fairly nice Holiday Inn, right off the I-81 and walking distance to a handful of restaurants. Only a few minor points to mention - free upgrade for PC platinum status forgotten, and a moldy banana in the breakfast area. Regardless, still a nice hotel. 7/10
reviews.title: Overall a fairly nice Holiday Inn
No problems - brand new hotel
reviews.text: Oh yes, the free soup. I didn't have any, but that is an unusual perk for a Holiday Inn Express. Good job!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a short 2-night stay and the hotel was great. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Being a new hotel, everything was immaculate and clean. Parking and access were very easy. HD TV in the room with many channels in HD. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast was good with quick service and a decent selection in the buffet. If I had to nit-pick, my only issues would be the lack of a stairway in the middle of the hotel (I felt silly taking the elevator from my 2nd floor room to breakfast), a few very minor random finishing details noticed in the bathroom (sloppy construction work), and the A/C didn't cool the room enough.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of the amenities it offered for such a reasonable price! It has an indoor pool and exercise equipment, and offers a continental breakfast daily. Staff was courteous and attentive, and the rooms were clean. We would definitely recommend this hotel to other visitors.
reviews.title: A good property, but not on par with other Garden Inns elsewhere.

reviews.text: As compared with other properties in Watertown this is a good property, however if compared with HGI’s elsewhere it’s subpar. HGI’s are one of my favorite properties, but as mentioned elsewhere this one falls short. Don’t get me wrong, even a subpar HGI is better than MOST other properties, however for what I was charged for this room, I expected more.
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Watertown-Thousand Islands
description: The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites - Watertown, New York is where great experiences begin at the Gateway to the 1000 Islands . We are in the heart of the Watertown, NY shopping district and located near exit 45 just off of I-81. The areas finest attractions, including Boldt Castle, Sackets Harbor and the St. Lawrence River, many local businesses, & Fort Drum are just minutes away. Our plaza includes Ruby Tuesday s, Starbucks, Buffalo Wild Wings, Ponderosa, Chipotle, Five Guys, Moe's, Cold Stone Creamery, Planet Fitness, Dollar General and a liquor store.Stay Smart with free wireless & wired high speed Internet access, free local phone calls, High Def TV & a guest business center. Begin your day with our complimentary Express Start Breakfast that includes hot items daily including pancakes and as always our signature cinnamon rolls. If you re on the run, pre-order a breakfast to go bag. Our Smart Roast 100% Arabica coffee is available 24 hours in our Great Room.
